subdivision_of_building: Proposal falls on an unoccupied part of the plot which has been subdivided
description:
Erection of a two storey end of terrace residential house comprising three bedrooms with associated 
cycle and refuse/recycling storage.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted; UPP Planning statement, unnumbered location plan, UPP Planning statement, unnumbered location plan, 034ME-A-02-001, 034ME-A-02 002, 034ME-A-03-001, 034ME-A-03-002, 034MEA-03-003, 034ME-A-03-006, 034ME-A-05-001, 034ME-A-05-002, 034ME-A-06-001, 034ME-A-06-002, 034ME-A-06-003, 034ME-A-06-004, UPP Fire strategy statement, Energy and sustainability statement
Received: 18/08/2023

034ME-A-01-001, 034ME-A-A01-002, 034ME-A-02-101, 034ME-A-02-102, 034ME-A-03-101, 034ME-A-03-102, 034ME-A-03-103, 034ME-A-03-106, 034ME-A-05-101, 034ME-A-05-102, 034ME-A-06-101, 034ME-A-06-102, 034ME-A-06-103, 034ME-A-06-104
Received: 02/11/2023

therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby approved shall match those used in the existing building at 34 Meadow Road, TW13 5JA.

Condition : 4 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8am to 6pm on Mondays to Friday and 9am to 1pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority. 

Prior to any demolition and construction work, neighbours shall be given details outlining construction timeframes (including when demolition and piling will take place).

Condition : 5 - The first floor bathroom formed in the front elevation as shown on drawing number 034ME-A-03-102, of the hereby approved development shall be obscure glazed, hinged to open inwards and shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than with obscured glazing.

Condition : 6 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 2015 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order) no enlargement of the hereby approved development or any additional structures/buildings within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out.

Condition : 7 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers literature) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105 Litres per person per day or less.

Condition : 8 - A)	No development above ground level shall take place until details have been submitted to and approved by the local planning authority which demonstrate that:
"	At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
"	At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
"	No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone. 
B)	The development shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of installation contracts) has been submitted to the local planning authority to demonstrate that the development has been carried out in accordance with the approved details under Part A of this condition. The development shall be maintained in accordance with the approved details at all times thereafter.

Condition : 9 - A)	No development shall take place until the applicant has entered into a binding arrangement with the Council that will secure a suitable contribution to the Council's Carbon Offset Fund, in accordance with the zero carbon strategy set out in the Energy Statement hereby approved.
B)	Prior to first occupation within the development hereby approved evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy and any subsequent approved revisions.

Condition : 10 - Prior to first occupation of the hereby approved development, details of secure and sheltered storage for 2 cycles, including manufacturer's specification, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.

Condition : 11 - Notwithstanding any details included in the submitted plans, prior to above ground works, details of landscape works shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. These details shall include:
(a) means of enclosure/boundary treatments
(b) pedestrian access and circulation areas;
(c) hard surfacing materials

Condition : 12 - Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved development the waste and recycling store shall be made available for use in strict accordance with the approved plans and shall thereafter be retained as such, without obstruction, for the duration of the development.
Condition : 13 - The rear garden shall be sub-divided as shown on the plan drawing numbered 034ME-A-01-002 and thereafter maintained as such for the duration of the development hereby permitted.
